question_text: Figure 19 shows two objects, E and D. E emits a sound. D detects the sound. E is moving in the direction shown by the arrow, but D is not moving. E emits a sound of wavelength 1.86 m. D measures the wavelength of this sound as 1.98 m. Calculate the difference between the wavelength that E emits and the wavelength that D detects. difference in wavelength = ..............................................................
subject: Physics

question_text: Figure 19 shows two objects, E and D. E emits a sound. D detects the sound. E is moving in the direction shown by the arrow, but D is not moving. E emits a sound of wavelength 1.86 m. D measures the wavelength of this sound as 1.98 m. The velocity of sound is 330 m / s. Calculate the velocity of E using the equation: velocity of E = velocity of sound × (difference in wavelength / wavelength emitted by E). velocity of E = ..............................................................
subject: Physics

question_text: The wavelength of light emitted from distant galaxies is different when the light is detected on Earth. Explain how this difference in wavelength shows that the Universe is expanding.
subject: Physics

question_text: CMB radiation provides evidence that the Universe had a definite beginning. subject: Physics

question_text: During the evolution of a star, the nebula collapses and becomes a main sequence star. State what causes the nebula to collapse.
subject: Physics

question_text: During the evolution of a star, the nebula collapses and becomes a main sequence star. Explain why the nebula stops collapsing as it becomes a main sequence star.
subject: Physics
